author: Madurai Bureau
text:
Martyrs’ Day marking the death anniversary of Mahatma Gandhi was observed by the Gandhian Study Centre of Sri Kumaragurupara Swamigal Arts College, Srivaikundam, at Gandhiji Balar Mandram, Ratnapuri- Kayalpattinam on Saturday.

A rally to Ratnapuri was flagged off by S. Sankaranarayanan, Principal of the college.

Placards with Gandhian messages were carried by the students on their march through the streets of Kalyalpattinam.

Oath

The participants took an oath against untouchability on the occasion.

Bhajans were sung, resonating the solemnity of the day, marking the great sacrifice of Gandhiji.

At Kadalaioor in Kovilpatti, the Martys’ Day programme was held at a memorial built for 34 freedom fighters, who played a vital role in the ‘Quit India Movement.’

Floral tributes were paid to the portraits of Mahatma Gandhi and the 34 martyrs of the movement by students of Sengunthar Higher Secondary School.

They also took out a rally through the thoroughfares of Kadalaioor.

Nagercoil

Mahatma Gandhi was remembered on his 69th death anniversary at his memorial in Kanyakumari on Saturday.

Collector Sajjansingh R. Chavan paid floral tributes to the ‘Father of the Nation’ along with former Minister N. Thalavai Sundaram, Kanyakumari MLA K. T. Pachaimal, Nagercoil MLA A. Nanjil Murugesan and representatives of local bodies.

To mark the occasion, the Sarvodaya Sangam had arranged for charka spinning for two weeks from Saturday. Ambika, Ponnammal and Anbarasi from the Sarvodaya Sangam participated in the event.
title: Tributes paid to Mahatma Gandhi
